info.description: API to create, update and manage account details for various entities like distributors, investors, fund etc.
info.title: Bank account detail

post.summary: Creates Bank account detailfor the specified parent
post.description: Creates Bank account detailfor the specified parent

parameters.name: command
parameters.description: API operations like INVOKE, VALIDATE, PROCESS can be set or by default PROCESS is set

post.summary: Creates Bank account detailwith parent mentioned in the payload
post.description: Creates Bank account detailwith parent mentioned in the payload

parameters.name: command
parameters.description: API operations like INVOKE, VALIDATE, PROCESS can be set or by default PROCESS is set

put.summary: Updates Bank account detailrecords with identifiers provided in the payload
put.description: Updates Bank account detailrecords with identifiers provided in the payload

parameters.name: command
parameters.description: API operations like INVOKE, VALIDATE, PROCESS can be set or by default PROCESS is set

delete.summary: Deletes Bank account detailrecords with identifiers provided in the payload
delete.description: Deletes Bank account detailrecords with identifiers provided in the payload

parameters.name: command
parameters.description: API operations like INVOKE, VALIDATE, PROCESS can be set or by default PROCESS is set

get.summary: Retrieves a specific Bank account detailrecord
get.description: Retrieves a specific Bank account detailrecord

parameters.name: size
parameters.description: Total number of records per page (Default:25)

parameters.name: orders
parameters.description: An 'orders' parameter allows you to specify the order in which rows appear in the result set Eg: orders=fundname:0,masterfund:1 where 'fundname' is field, '0' for ascending manner and ',' as seperator for fields

parameters.name: groups
parameters.description: A 'groups' parameter is used to collect data across multiple records and group the results by one or more columns. Eg: groups=nationality,reclaimtax-nationality:EQ:Indian,reclaimtax:EQ:N-nationality:COUNT where 'nationality,reclaimtax' is for the fields and 'nationality:EQ:Indian,reclaimtax:EQ:N-nationality' are filters, 'nationality:COUNT' is a aggregator and '-' as seperator

parameters.name: filters
parameters.description: Use a 'filters' parameter to select rows based on a value by using basic operators like EQ, NE etc.., Eg: filters=statistictype:NE:SRS where 'statistictype' is a field, 'NE' is a operator and 'SRS' is a value

parameters.name: command
parameters.description: API operations like INVOKE, VALIDATE, PROCESS can be set or by default PROCESS is set

reference.description: Contains external and internal identifiers of the record

entityType.description: Identifies the entity. For e.g. 0001 for registers, 0002 for agents, 0007 for investors, etc.

internalId.description: Internal identifier of the records.  Generated by the system during POST and can be used for other operations

promoterInternalId.description: Internal identifier of the Fund promoter linked to the entity

promoterExternalId.description: External identifier of the Fund promoter linked to the entity

parent.description: Contains external and internal identifiers of the parent record, if the current record belongs to sub entities

parentEntityType.description: Identifies the parent entity. For e.g. 0001 for registers, 0002 for agents, 0007 for investors, etc.

parentInternalId.description: Internal identifier of the parent record

parentExternalId.description: External identifier of the parent record

parentPromoterInternalId.description: Internal identifier of the Fund promoter linked to the parent entity

parentPromoterExternalId.description: External identifier of the Fund promoter linked to the parent entity

bankaccount.description: Contains individual attributes of the Bankaccount entity

accountCurrency.description: The bank account currency code( in 3 letter format eg : USD). The LoV is available in the CMESS table MONNAIES.

beneficiaryAccountName.description: Name of the Beneficiary Account Holder

correspondantAccountName1.description: Name of the Correspondant Account Holder1

correspondantAccountName2.description: Name of the Correspondant Account Holder2

correspondantAccountName3.description: Name of the Correspondant Account Holder3

correspondantAccountName4.description: Name of the Correspondant Account Holder4

correspondantAccountName5.description: Name of the Correspondant Account Holder5

nettingGroup.description: The description of cash movements of the bank to be grouped and / or netted . For example: 01(No grouping/no netting), 02(Grouping/No netting), 03(Grouping/Netting). The LoV is available in the CMESS table TA_GRPNET.

groupNettingType.description: Grouping/Netting type of the cash movements.  For exmample: 0001(N/A), 0002(Per trade and ccy), 0003(Per trade date, settlemet date and currency)etc.  The LoV is available in the CMESS table TA_GNETTYP.

accountType.description: The account type code. For example : 0000 (Main Account), 0001  (Fund) etc. The LoV is available in the CMESS table TA_ACC_TYP.

finalBeneficiary.description: Name of the FFC account holder

taFundId.description: Fund Internal ID linked to the Bank Account. Allowed values are from the list of TA Fund in MFGI.

taFundExternalId.description: Fund External ID linked to the Bank Account.

operationCode.description: Operation code linked to the bank account. For example: 0001(Subscription), 0002(Redemption), 0005(Reinvestment)etc. The LoV is available in the CMESS table TA_COPER.

chargesFlag.description: It specifies if the bank charges are associated to the wire. Allowed values: Y (Yes), N(No). The LoV is available in the CMESS table CHARGE.

chargesCode.description: It specifies the entity who should bear the bank charges associated to the wire. For example: BEN(Beneficiary), OUR (Sender), SHA(Shared) etc.  The LoV is available in the CMESS table CHARGE_DET.

accountReference.description: Free text to add any special information specific to payments in the account

finalBeneficiaryType.description: The final beneficiary type. For example: 202(Financial institution),103(Non financial institution) or DD(Direct debit collection). The LoV is available in the CMESS table TYPE.

ibanCode.description: The International Bank Account Number (IBAN) , internationally agreed system of identifying bank accounts across national borders.

ibanCode1.description: The International Bank Account Number (IBAN) of Correspondant Bank1

ibanCode2.description: The International Bank Account Number (IBAN) of Correspondant Bank2

ibanCode3.description: The International Bank Account Number (IBAN) of Correspondant Bank3

ibanCode4.description: The International Bank Account Number (IBAN) of Correspondant Bank4

ibanCode5.description: The International Bank Account Number (IBAN) of Correspondant Bank5

shareClass.description: Share class to which the bank account is linked. Allowed values are from the list of shareclass code in MFGI.

fccReference.description: Free text to add any special information specific to payments in the account

thirdPartyPaymentFlag.description: Flag allows to use this bank account detail for third party payments. Allowed values: Y(for Yes), N(for No).

paySwiftFlag.description: Flag allows to use the Beneficiary Bank SWIFT code while creating payment instruction. Allowed values: Y(for Yes), N(for No).

paySwiftFlag1.description: Flag allows to use the Beneficiary Bank1 SWIFT code while creating payment instruction. Allowed values: Y(for Yes), N(for No).

paySwiftFlag2.description: Flag allows to use the Beneficiary Bank2 SWIFT code while creating payment instruction. Allowed values: Y(for Yes), N(for No).

paySwiftFlag3.description: Flag allows to use the Beneficiary Bank SWIFT3 code while creating payment instruction. Allowed values: Y(for Yes), N(for No).

paySwiftFlag4.description: Flag allows to use the Beneficiary Bank SWIFT4 code while creating payment instruction. Allowed values: Y(for Yes), N(for No).

paySwiftFlag5.description: Flag allows to use the Beneficiary Bank SWIFT5 code while creating payment instruction. Allowed values: Y(for Yes), N(for No).

payRoutingFlag.description: Flag allows to use the beneficiary bank routing method while creating payment instruction. Allowed values: Y(for Yes), N(for No).

payRoutingFlag1.description: Flag allows to use the Beneficiary Bank1 routing method while creating payment instruction. Allowed values: Y(for Yes), N(for No).

payRoutingFlag2.description: Flag allows to use the Beneficiary Bank2 routing method while creating payment instruction. Allowed values: Y(for Yes), N(for No).

payRoutingFlag3.description: Flag allows to use the Beneficiary Bank3 routing method while creating payment instruction. Allowed values: Y(for Yes), N(for No).

payRoutingFlag4.description: Flag allows to use the Beneficiary Bank4 routing method while creating payment instruction. Allowed values: Y(for Yes), N(for No).

payRoutingFlag5.description: Flag allows to use the Beneficiary Bank5 routing method while creating payment instruction. Allowed values: Y(for Yes), N(for No).

pendingPaymentStopFlag.description: Flag allows to  suspend any pending payments in case a change to the bank mandate has been received. Allowed values: Y(for Yes), N(for No).

correspondantId.description: Beneficiary Bank Internal ID. Allowed values are from the list of Ids in MFGI.

sepaCompliant.description: Flag to enable Bank Account for SEPA compliant.  Allowed values: Y(for Yes), N(for No).

productCode.description: Product code. Allowed values are from the list of product ids in MFGI.
